intro: Phyllanthus incrustatus, commonly known as the stonecress or rock cress, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its dense, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Phyllanthus incrustatus is often found in regions with poor soil, demonstrating its resilience and ecological significance.
